title: Classic Arts and Crafts Furniture - 14 Timeless Designs (gnv64)
description:
Classic Arts and Crafts Furniture - 14 Timeless Designs (Magbook)
by Robert W. Lang
Popular Woodworking Books | 2013 | PDF | 163 pages | 17.1 mb

Beautiful fumed oak. Rich cherry wood. Ebony accents. These are the hallmarks of the fi nest Arts & Crafts furniture. And theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re the features youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll fi nd in the 14 elegant woodworking projects in this book. Author Bob Lang, well known for his meticulously detailed shop drawings of Arts & Crafts furniture, shows you how to go beyond drawings to create timeless designs in the style of Gustav Stickley, Greene & Greene and more. From a desktop bookrack to hall tables, easy chairs and beyond, youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll fi nd projects for just about every room in your home. And Bob has provided thorough, stepby- step instructions, clear illustrations and high-quality photographs to help you build each one.

About The Author
Robert W. Lang grew up in northeastern Ohio and has been a professional woodworker since the early 1970s. He learned woodworking repairing wooden boats on Lake Erie and in a large commercial shop in Cleveland. Along the way he studied industrial design at The Ohio State University, and his experience includes building custom furniture and cabinets as well as managing and engineering large architectural millwork projects. Bob joined the staff of Popular Woodworking Magazine in 2004 and is Executive Editor. He is the author of several Ã¢â‚¬Å“Shop DrawingsÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ books about furniture and interiors of the Arts & Crafts Movement of the early 1900s.
